001package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup;
002
003import org.immutables.value.Value;
004import org.jgrapht.generate.GnpRandomGraphGenerator;
005import org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge;
006import org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
010
011import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
012
013/**
014 * Erdos‑Reyni (G(n,p)) network configuration.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * Provides parameters used to generate a random graph under the G(n,p) model.
018 * The graph generator is used during the {@code setupOutbreak} stage by the
019 * model builder to populate the social network graph.
020 *
021 * @author Rob Challen
022 */
023@Value.Immutable
024@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableErdosReyniConfiguration.class)
025@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableErdosReyniConfiguration.class)
026public interface ErdosReyniConfiguration extends NetworkConfiguration {
027
028        /**
029         * Default Erdos‑Reyni configuration used in examples and tests.
030         *
031         * <p>
032         * The default supplies a simple parameterisation of the G(n,p) model with
033         * 16,384 nodes and an average degree of 100. This is a compact baseline for
034         * examples and tests that require a non‑trivial network.
035         */
036        public static ImmutableErdosReyniConfiguration DEFAULT = ImmutableErdosReyniConfiguration
037                        .builder().setNetworkSize(128 * 128).setNetworkDegree(100).build();
038
039        /**
040         * Populate the supplied social network graph using the stored parameters.
041         *
042         * @param socialNetwork a mutable JGraphT graph to populate
043         */
044        @Override
045        default void generateGraph(SimpleGraph<Person, DefaultEdge> socialNetwork) {
046                GnpRandomGraphGenerator<Person, DefaultEdge> gen = new GnpRandomGraphGenerator<>(
047                                this.getNetworkSize(),
048                                ((double) this.getNetworkDegree() + 1.0) / this.getNetworkSize()
049                );
050                gen.generateGraph(socialNetwork);
051        }
052}
